title: It's Never Over
summary:
Completed in 1930 while the author was living in Paris - imbibing and boxing with James Joyce and Ernest Hemingway - this novel has violence at its core. 

The story opens with the hanging of an ex-World War I soldier for involuntary murder. First and foremost, though, it is a story of love - a love haunted by that hanging.
story_arc: Opens with good fortunes, but doomed to fail
